style.name: Specialty Stouts
style.description: See British Origin American-Style Imperial Porter Imperial porters are very dark brown to black in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/astringent black malt character should be perceived. Medium malt, caramel and cocoa-like sweetness should be in harmony with medium-low to medium hop bitterness. This is a full bodied beer. Ale-like fruity esters should be evident but not overpowering and compliment malt derived sweetness and hop character. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being low to medium-high. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: South Shore Brewery
breweries.description: The South Shore Brewery is dedicated to producing flavorful, innovative products. We use the best of traditional techniques and tap the resources of originality from our professional staff.

data.name: Chocolate Mint Stout
data.description: “This brew is from my award winning base beer “Black Sand Beach”, a Russian Imperial Stout with a twist. I love the mints they put on the pillows in posh hotels, so mint chocolate was added to this intensely flavored dark ale. Rich flavors of chocolate, cocoa, coffee, fruits, and malty grains mingle with the chocolate mint to give a refreshing cooling flavor that persists from beginning to finish. Watch for future releases. Mahalo!”

style.name: American-Style Imperial Stout
style.description: Black in color, American-style imperial stouts typically have a high alcohol content. Generally characterized as very robust. The extremely rich malty flavor and aroma are balanced with assertive hopping and fruity-ester characteristics. Bitterness should be moderately high to very high and balanced with full sweet malt character. Roasted malt astringency and bitterness can be moderately perceived but should not overwhelm the overall character. Hop aroma is usually moderately-high to overwhelmingly hop-floral, -citrus or -herbal. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: Iron Fist Brewing Company
breweries.description: Iron Fist Brewing Company is a family owned brewery located in Vista, California, smack-dab in the middle of the exciting San Diego craft beer scene. Our passion for the best hand crafted beer prompted us to make a lot of it. However, we quickly realized we were making a bit more than we could drink ourselves, so we decided to sell whatever we don't drink to you. So do yourself a favor; start a little revolution. It's ok. We won't tell on you. Put the 500 pack of light lager back with all its buddies and rule your taste with an Iron Fist!

data.name: Chocolate Mint Stout
data.description: Brewed for the holiday season, this stout was made with dark Belgian chocolate, fresh mint leaves and six specialty malts. Starts with the aroma of fresh peppermint, with the robust flavor of the chocolate next, and finishes with a minty balance.

style.name: Sweet or Cream Stout
style.description: Sweet stouts, also referred to as cream stouts, have less roasted bitter flavor and a full-bodied mouthfeel. The style can be given more body with milk sugar (lactose) before bottling. Malt sweetness, chocolate, and caramel flavor should dominate the flavor profile and contribute to the aroma. Hops should balance and suppress some of the sweetness without contributing apparent flavor or aroma. The overall impression should be sweet and full-bodied.

breweries.name: Empire Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Empire Brewing Company began as a contemporary Microbrewery & Restaurant in Syracuse, New York. Established in 1994, we have served our national & international award winning ales & lagers exclusively to the craft beer pallets of Central New York.
In 2010, we expanded our proprietary brewing practice to Brooklyn, NY. We are excited to offer you the fruits of our labor in a pint glass. Thank you for your patronage & please enjoy responsibly.

Cheers!
empire brewing company

breweries.name: Loe's Brewing Company
breweries.description: Loe's Brewing Company  is a small craft brewery located in Hickory North Carolina. We specialize in handcrafted artisanal lagers and ales. We are one of the smallest breweries in North Carolina and also one of the smallest in the country. We have a 1.5 bbl brewhouse , 1 and 3 bbl fermentation tanks. Being so small we can afford to take more time and effort into our beers. We utilize many ingredients from all over the world, selecting only the finest grains, cultured yeast, fresh whole hops, and  our mountain water that is perfect for producing the best beers possible.  Another advantage of being small is that we can produce a wide variety of styles so our selection will always be changing. We will produce beers that fit the season and year round classics. Loe's Brewing takes pride in producing the finest handcrafted beers, and we are sure that once you try our beer you will agree that bigger is not always better , and will notice the difference that craft beer has to offer.  Cheers- The Loe's Brewing Team

breweries.name: Kokopelli Beer Company
breweries.description: Kokopelli Beer Company is a small brewpub located in the Solaire Shoppes at 8931 Harlan Street in Westminster Colorado, just across from the future Westminster Mall renovation. We enjoy brewing quality handcrafted ales and meeting new folks, so we decided to put them together. As a brew pub, we offer a small menu to compliment our ales with items such as pizzas, sandwiches, salads and more.

data.name: Chocolate Oak Aged Yeti
data.description: CHOCOLATE OAK AGED YETI IMPERIAL STOUT is another revered incarnation of our legendary imperial stout. We toned down the hops a bit to allow cocoa nibs to contribute some pleasing bitterness, while vanilla notes from the oak combine with the cocoa to create an aroma and flavor akin to a gourmet chocolate bar. A dash of cayenne keeps things lively, adding just a bit of heat to the finish. Another great Yeti? Hell yes.
data.foodPairings: Raw oysters, grilled NY strip, chicken mole, Roaring 40’s blue cheese, crème bruleé, chocolate raspberry mousse cake.

breweries.name: Great Divide Brewing Company
breweries.description:
These beers have landed an impressive amount of acclaim: Great Divide beers have earned 18 Great American Beer Festival medals and 5 World Beer Cup awards. Great Divide was also ranked 8th in Ratebeer.com’s 2010 “The Best Brewers in the World” and was ranked 7th in Beer Advocate’s 2009 “All-Time Top Breweries on Planet Earth.”

But why take their word for it? Crack open a bottle and decide for yourself.

data.name: Chocolate Oatmeal Porter
data.description: Brewed with nothing but the highest quality English ingredients, including floor-malted Maris Otter, Oat Malt, and two types of Chocolate Malt, this Chocolate Oatmeal Porter is sure to please. The end result is a malty, full bodied oatmeal porter.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Brown Porter
style.description: Brown porters are mid to dark brown (may have red tint) in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Blue Pants Brewery
breweries.description:
Blue Pants Brewery was born out of a love of craft beer and craft beer culture. This first brewery is meant to be a gateway to the second and an inspiration to other small brewers that it can be done on this scale with a healthy amount of hard work. We’ve already had phone calls and emails from other brewers who are planning to follow in our footsteps, and we provide any help that we can. 

The Brewery will consist of a 1.5 Barrel (or about 45 gallon) brewing system. Initially, distribution will be in 1/4 Barrel kegs to bars around the area, draft only. All the beer will be keg conditioned prior to distribution to ensure that it is at its maximum freshness, finishing the fermentation the moment it is loaded on a refridgerated truck out of the brewery.

breweries.name: White Dog Brewing Co.
breweries.description: East end of Bozeman on Main

style.name: Oatmeal Stout
style.description: Oatmeal stouts include oatmeal in their grist, resulting in a pleasant, full flavor and a smooth profile that is rich without being grainy. A roasted malt character which is caramel-like and chocolate-like should be evident - smooth and not bitter. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas (chocolate and nut-like) are prominent. Color is dark brown to black. Bitterness is moderate, not high. Hop flavor and aroma are optional but should not overpower the overall balance if present. This is a medium- to full- bodied beer, with minimal fruity esters. Diacetyl should be absent or at extremely low levels. Original gravity range and alcohol levels are indicative of English tradition of oatmeal stout.

breweries.name: Pub Dog Pizza & Drafthouse
breweries.description:
Pub Dog Pizza & Drafthouse opened in 2001 on Cross St. in the historic neighborhood of Federal Hill in Baltimore.  It immediately became a hit with neighborhood residents, suburbanites, and tourists alike.

Pub Dog quickly became famous for our gourmet personal-sized thin-crust pizzas, fresh salads, and "Dog Deal" beers - 2 mugs of our own house craft beer for one low price all the time.  

We developed a loyal late night following by serving food every night until 1:30 and staying open until 2:00AM every night.

Pub Dog expanded outside of the city in 2007, opening a location in Columbia.

Pub Dog began bottling some of our house beers for sale to go in 2007.  The bottles are now available at both pubs and in liquor stores around the state.

data.name: Chocolate Oatmeal Stout
data.description:
This is a dark, deliciously roasty brew with hints of chocolate in both flavor and aroma. This stout is velevety smooth with a dry, roasted finish.

We used to brew this seasonally but now make it available all year for our loyal Stout customers!

breweries.name: Trout River Brewing
breweries.description:
Trout River Brewing was founded in July 1996 by Dan and Laura Gates. We began brewing in early December of that year. We still own and operate this microbrewery in the northeastern region of Vermont--The Northeast Kingdom! Come visit this special and beautiful place and taste all that the Kingdom has to offer.

Trout River Brewing prides itself on creating and serving fresh, all natural, premium ales and lagers. Our beers are made with pure Vermont water, the best imported and domestic malts and hops, and quality yeasts. Nothing else is added and we take nothing away!

breweries.name: Shoug Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Shoug Brewing Company is a family ran business that should begin delivering beer to the SW Washington Area in June, 2017.  The Brewer consist of a 5 bbl, Gas Fired Brewhouse, 3 - 7 bbl Fermenter and 2 - 5 bbl bright tanks.  We will be a production Brewery and unfortunately we will not have a tap room on site.  So, we will be listing the locations where you can find our beers on our website and Facebook page. 

All our beer will be made with locally purchased ingredients of the highest quality.  Our goal is to give you full flavored, well balanced beers that keep you coming back for more.  We hope you enjoy our products and please friend us on Facebook and help us spread the word as we get started.

style.name: American-Style Imperial Stout
style.description: Black in color, American-style imperial stouts typically have a high alcohol content. Generally characterized as very robust. The extremely rich malty flavor and aroma are balanced with assertive hopping and fruity-ester characteristics. Bitterness should be moderately high to very high and balanced with full sweet malt character. Roasted malt astringency and bitterness can be moderately perceived but should not overwhelm the overall character. Hop aroma is usually moderately-high to overwhelmingly hop-floral, -citrus or -herbal. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: Lickinghole Creek Craft Brewery
breweries.description:
Lickinghole Creek Craft Brewery is a water-conscious, biologically friendly farm brewery carefully crafting Belgium-style beers and growing hops, barley and other adjuncts. See our Farm Plan 2014 and read about the barley, hops, strawberries, pumpkins and the upcoming new additions of figs trees, blueberries, herbs, sunflowers, additional pumpkin terraced fields and a hardy orange tree grove.  Farmer Russell has ordered our new additions and will be breaking ground this February. We operate on a beautiful working farm in the heart of Virginia.

Lickinghole Creek is a water-conscious brewery.  We brew with well water drawn from the deep.  Our wastewater is purified on site and returned to the Lickinghole Creek watershed.

Our name pays homage to Little Lickinghole Creek, which runs through the farm’s rolling hills.  Since precolonial times the creek has been known as the Lickinghole where wildlife stopped to drink from the nourishing waters.  May the tradition continue.

data.name: Chocolate Orange
data.description:
Saranac Chocolate Orange is a limited edition small batch brew from our "High Peaks" series, a line of beers that are bigger, more complex and flavorful. Brewed as a full bodied robust Baltic-style porter with five different hops and four different malts, this beer pushes the porter style to a new level. 

We start with generous amounts of chocolate malt, and then add blood orange peel. In fermentation, the finest hand-selected, purest cacao nibs are added to enhance the chocolate malt flavor. Look for a dark chocolate roasted flavor finished off with a unique surprise from blood orange peel, making this an extra special treat!

style.name: Baltic-Style Porter
style.description: A true smooth cold-fermented and cold lagered beer, brewed with lager yeast. Black to very deep ruby/garnet in color. Overall, Baltic Porters have a very smooth lagered character with distinctive caramelized sugars, licorice and chocolate-like character of roasted malts and dark sugars. Roasted dark malts should not contribute bitterness, or astringent roast character. A low degree of smokiness from malt may be evident. Debitterized roast malts are best used for this style. Because of its alcoholic strength, aroma may include gentle (low) lager fruitiness (berries, grapes, plums, not banana; ale-like fruitiness from warm temperature fermentation is not appropriate), complex alcohols, cocoa-like, roast malt (and sometimes coffee-like roast barley, yet not bitter). Hop aroma is very low, though a hint of floral or sweet hop aroma can complement aromatics and flavor without dominance. Baltic Porters are not hop bitter dominated and expressed as low to medium-low. Baltic porters range from having medium to full body complemented with a medium-low to medium level of malty sweetness. No butterscotch-like diacetyl or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be apparent in aroma or flavor.

breweries.name: Saranac Brewery
breweries.description: Our attention to detail and uncompromising commitment to quality represent the signature trademark of the Matt Brewing Company and our award-winning Saranac Beers.

style.description: American-style imperial porters are black in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/astringent black malt character should be perceived. Medium malt, caramel and cocoa-like sweetness. Hop bitterness is perceived at a medium-low to medium level. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being low to medium-high. This is a full bodied beer. Ale-like fruity esters should be evident but not overpowering and compliment hop character and malt derived sweetness. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: Imperial Oak Brewing
breweries.description: Imperial Oak Brewing is a Micro brewery focused on brewing high gravity beers with many barrel and wood aged offerings. We'll have some incredible session-able beer in there somewhere too.

data.name: Chocolate Orange Mead
data.description: A true reserve a year and a half in the making! Our Chocolate Orange Mead combines the bitter-sweet flavors of dark chocolate and citrus in a decadent elixir! Orange juice and cocoa powder are added to the fermentation, combined with North Carolina sourced wildflower honey and five different strains of yeast. Aged one year on ten pounds of Venezuelan Mantuano cocoa nibs - a variety selected for its delicate nuttiness, light apricot flavor, and hints of toffee - hand-roasted by our mead maker. Save for special occasions or share with someone you love!

style.name: Open Category Mead
style.description: This mead should exhibit the character of all of the ingredients in varying degrees, and should show a good blending or balance between the various flavor elements. Whatever ingredients are included, the result should be identifiable as a honey-based fermented beverage.

breweries.name: Starrlight Mead
breweries.description:
After several years as home mead makers, we are thrilled to be opening Starrlight Mead. We have had a fantastic time making mead and meeting mead drinkers from all over the world, and now its our turn to share our love of mead with all of you!

Becky Starr, Owner, Sales/Tasting Room Manager
Ben Starr, Owner, Wine/Meadmaker

We first discovered mead in CA at the Southern California Renaissance Pleasure Faire. Several years later, we found friends that were home brewing mead with good results. We decided to try our hand at it too.

In February 2006, we entered our first competition and took Best in Show out of over 210 entries in the home mead-maker category at the International Mead Association’s Mead Festival. The competition was judged by seven professionals in the mead industry; including Ken Schramm, author of The Compleat Mead Maker, and meadery owners from around the world. The Best in Show prize was selected from the gold medal winners in nine categories. Our “Starrlight Mulled Apple Cyser” was awarded not only the gold medal in the cyser (mead made with apples) category, but was also selected as the best overall representation of mead making. It was at that point we decided to try creating a business from our love of mead.

Ben shares his expertise and love of brewing by conducting demonstrations and workshops on mead making in the local community. We also organize and conduct the local Mead Day celebration each August (since 2005) and are a key part of the product tasting team for mead reviews on Gotmead.com. Becky worked with Chatham Hill Winery for 2 years learning tasting room and wine club management. We are members of the Chatham County Beekeepers Association, and the NC Winegrowers Association.

breweries.name: Rochester Mills Beer Company
breweries.description: The Rochester Mills Beer Co. opened in 1998 in Downtown Rochester. Located in the historic Western Knitting Mill, the brewery is located on Water Street, just two blocks east of Main Street. Preserving the original character of the building, the brewery features original hardwood floors, columns, beams and exposed brick walls. The menu features a broad selection of eclectic American cuisine, all prepared with the freshest ingredients. From delectable appetizers, fresh salads, pizzas and pastas to delicious entrees and unique sandwiches, the menu has something for everyone and a kids menu is available. Special amenities include an outdoor patio, pool tables,  Greenhorn Music Night every Thursday starting at 9pm, and live entertainment every Friday, and Saturday nights starting at 10pm. The Martini Lounge is available for private parties.

breweries.name: Brewery Terra Firma
breweries.description:
Brewery Terra Firma is unique in its approach as a brewery and as an agricultural destination. Through the integration of sustainable production methods, environmentally conscious waste management and innovative water recycling/reclamation techniques, we hope to become a model for breweries and agricultural destinations throughout the nation.

The BrewhouseThe brew house is an engineered mix of new and old technologies and techniques. Whole ingredients are used with traditional brewing equipment which is controlled by state of the art systems that manage temperature throughout the brewing process. These same systems harvest waste BTU's, capturing the energy that would normally be lost and reusing it to preheat ingredients, maintain product temperatures, and even heat the taproom via an in-floor heating system. Waste materials such as process water and spent grain are also captured and stored for fertilization and irrigation of our crops.

The prep table in the brewery quite often looks like the prep area in a fine restaurant. Fresh herbs, fruits and vegetables are a common sight, along with an amazing array of spices, roots and even flowers. Whole foods, fresh frozen or dried are used, artificial flavorings, extracts and coloring agents are not. The beer is unfiltered, its clarity being attained by the addition of natural clarifying agents and allowing ample time for the beer to condition.

Brewery Terra Firma began brewing operations in May of 2013, with the taproom opening to the public in July of the same year.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation: 10:00 AM to 10:00 PM Monday through Saturday, and from 2:00 PM to 9:00 PM on Sunday
locations.hoursOfOperationNotes: 10:00 AM to 10:00 PM Monday through Saturday, and from 2:00 PM to 9:00 PM on Sunday

data.name: Chocolate Orange Port Pymet
data.description:
Chocolate/Orange Port Pyment.
This desert still mead is made with citrus honey, port wine, with balanced orange chocolate finish. Deep purple in color.  This mead is a mead to be savored.
Serve at 55-60F (13-16C)

style.name: Sweet Mead
style.description: Similar in balance, body, finish and flavor intensity to a well-made dessert wine (such as Sauternes), with a pleasant mixture of honey character, residual sweetness, soft fruity esters, and clean alcohol. Complexity, harmony, and balance of sensory elements are most desirable, with no inconsistencies in color, aroma, flavor or aftertaste. The proper balance of sweetness, acidity, alcohol and honey character is the essential final measure of any mead.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:

data.name: Chocolate Owl Porter
data.description: Medium bodied porter with a solid malt backbone, notes of toffee & chocolate with an earthy fuggle hop.

style.name: Robust Porter
style.description: Robust porters are black in color and have a roast malt flavor, often reminiscent of cocoa, but no roast barley flavor. These porters have a sharp bitterness of black malt without a highly burnt/charcoal flavor. Caramel and other malt sweetness should be present and in harmony with other distinguishing porter characters. Robust porters range from medium to full in body and have a malty sweetness. Hop bitterness is medium to high, with hop aroma and flavor ranging from negligible to medium. Diacetyl is acceptable at very low levels. Fruity esters should be evident, balanced with roast malt and hop bitterness.

breweries.name: Prairie Street Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Prairie Street Brewing Co. offers world-class beer handcrafted locally in a range of styles from lagers to IPAs, stouts to saisons and every style in between, our 14 faucets and 2 beer engines will offer something for everyone. Our brewer crafts each beer following the highest standards for quality and freshness, so every glass poured is consistently delicious.
Nothing compliments a great beer better than great food. At PSB we understand this, and that is why both beer and food menus are being created in tandem. Our menu is dynamic, reflecting the change of seasons and the availability of the freshest ingredients. Be sure to check in often to taste our newest fermented and culinary creations.

style.name: Sweet or Cream Stout
style.description: Sweet stouts, also referred to as cream stouts, have less roasted bitter flavor and a full-bodied mouthfeel. The style can be given more body with milk sugar (lactose) before bottling. Malt sweetness, chocolate, and caramel flavor should dominate the flavor profile and contribute to the aroma. Hops should balance and suppress some of the sweetness without contributing apparent flavor or aroma. The overall impression should be sweet and full-bodied.

breweries.name: Imperial Oak Brewing
breweries.description: Imperial Oak Brewing is a Micro brewery focused on brewing high gravity beers with many barrel and wood aged offerings. We'll have some incredible session-able beer in there somewhere too.

style.name: American-Style Stout
style.description: Initial low to medium malt sweetness with a degree of caramel, chocolate and/or roasted coffee flavor with a distinctive dryroasted bitterness in the finish. Coffee-like roasted barley and roasted malt aromas are prominent. Some slight roasted malt acidity is permissible and a medium- to full-bodied mouthfeel is appropriate. Hop bitterness may be moderate to high. Hop aroma and flavor is moderate to high, often with American citrus-type and/or resiny hop character. The perception of fruity esters is low. Roasted malt/barley astringency may be low but not excessive. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be negligible or not perceived. Head retention is excellent.

breweries.name: Dry Dock Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Dry Dock Brewing Co. is a speakeasy that hasn’t stopped growing. The brewery was Aurora, Colorado’s first when owners Kevin DeLange and Michelle Reding opened with a 7 BBL brewhouse in a 900-square-foot space next their original business The Brew Hut, a homebrew supply shop, in 2005. They named the brewery as a nod to Kevin’s love of nautical history.

Dry Dock expanded in 2009, and again in 2011. Now the brewery runs a 7 BBL brewhouse including a tasting room with 180 seats and 16 taps at its original location at 15120 E. Hampden Avenue which is called South Dock.

In 2013, Dry Dock nearly quadrupled its production numbers, jumping from 3,200 barrels in 2012 to 12,000 barrels in one year. This increase came with the purchase of a 30,000-square-foot production facility, North Dock, at 2801 Tower Road. At North Dock, Dry Dock has the capacity to expand to brew more than 30,000 barrels a year, and cans its flagship line of beers, including the Amber Ale, Hop Abomination, Hazy IPA, and Apricot Blonde.

In September of 2014, Dry Dock opened the Canoe Room, a 12-tap tasting room inside of its North Dock facility. The tasting room, which in addition to draft beer, serves Dry Dock’s canned offerings. The public can also enjoy the five acres that North Dock sits on with its 18-hole disc golf course that was built in 2015. 

Dry Dock established itself early on by word-of-mouth, and put itself on the map when it won a gold 2006 World Beer Cup (only 6 months after the tiny brewery opened) for its HMS Victory ESB (now Dry Dock’s Amber Ale). Dry Dock has since been the recipient of 20 GABF® medals, the prestigious Brewers Association’s Small Brewery of the Year award, and five World Beer Cup® awards.

data.name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Porter
data.description: We took a classic English porter recipe, boosted up the chocolate malt and flavor, then added big aroma's of peanut butter and chocolate with layers of chocolate overtones all tied together with a slightly roasty & bitter finish. This will not last long so enjoy whle it's here!

style.name: Brown Porter
style.description: Brown porters are mid to dark brown (may have red tint) in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Waconia Brewing Company
breweries.description: WBC was founded by two families with an entrepreneurial spirit and a love of craft beers. Waconia Brewing started as many breweries have, with the gift of a home brewing kit which fueled a dream to take their passions to the next level. WBC is the realization of that dream, created for all to enjoy. Our taproom features 4 namesake beers in constant supply as well as ever-changing seasonal selections and limited edition specialty brews available by the glass or to take with you in one of our growlers.

data.name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Porter
data.description: A full bodied porter that gets its dark luscious color from the generous use of roasted malts.  You’ll get just the right amount of chocolate and peanut butter to question whether you’re drinking a glass of delicious suds or popping a peanut butter cup in your mouth.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Brown Porter
style.description: Brown porters are mid to dark brown (may have red tint) in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Horny Goat Brewing Company
breweries.description: We’re often questioned about the origin of our name. Our story has it that “Spanish Fly Brewing” sounded too clumsy. Another says it was a bet at a card game. A third we’ve been advised by our lawyers not to discuss. While each rendition may have some truth to it, what it really boils down to is quite simple: Beer is fun. Brewing is fun. Drinking beer with your buddies is fun. So, why not a name that’s fun? After all, we’re in the business of helping people enjoy life. And we take our business very seriously. Our beers are craft-brewed for Old World taste and new world refreshment. Savored, slammed or sipped,these beers are also brewed to be sold and we plan on selling a lot of them. Aggressive marketing campaigns are in place to make sure Horny Goat Beers are on the radar of beer purchasers in select markets. Radio commercials, point-of-sale, guerilla tactics, swag, social media, you name it ‘cause we plan on growing, and growing large quickly. Kind of like a horny goat. So prepare yourself, the world is about to become a much hornier place.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style Imperial Porter
style.description: American-style imperial porters are black in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/astringent black malt character should be perceived. Medium malt, caramel and cocoa-like sweetness. Hop bitterness is perceived at a medium-low to medium level. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being low to medium-high. This is a full bodied beer. Ale-like fruity esters should be evident but not overpowering and compliment hop character and malt derived sweetness. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: Fort Myers Brewing Company
breweries.description: Lee County's first microbrewery. Award winning craft ales brewed 7 barrels at a time.

data.name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Stout
data.description: A well-rounded stout brewed with seven varieties of malts, two varieties of hops, chocolate and peanut butter. Hints of dark chocolate, coffee, and molasses.

breweries.name: Four Mile Brewing Company
breweries.description: Four Mile Brewing was born from a desire to create a high quality, premium, local beer - a product that the people of the area would be proud to call their own. So, why the name Four Mile Brewing? The Four Mile Valley and its natural resources are what embody every aspect of the Greater Olean Area; its natural resources are what drive our industries and it is deeply rooted in farming and agriculture. The surrounding mountain ridges provide endless recreational opportunities and draw tourists from all over the region for their beauty and sense of adventure.  Its views have inspired countless students at St. Bonaventure University and are part of the tradition at that school.

data.name: Chocolate Pistachio Porter
data.description: We thought a nice, rich brew was in order during the colder months. Brewed with English malts and a generous amount of cocoa powder. This beer is warming and full bodied. As the brew warms, the chocolate character and sweetness rolls out of the top of the glass.

style.name: American-Style Imperial Porter
style.description: American-style imperial porters are black in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/astringent black malt character should be perceived. Medium malt, caramel and cocoa-like sweetness. Hop bitterness is perceived at a medium-low to medium level. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being low to medium-high. This is a full bodied beer. Ale-like fruity esters should be evident but not overpowering and compliment hop character and malt derived sweetness. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: Infusion Brewing Company
breweries.description: Located in the heart of the "Benson Beer District" in Omaha, Nebraska, and built in the historic former home of Olson's Meat Market , Infusion Brewing Company brews up great hand crafted beers with a locally sourced twist! Our beers are available through our on-site tap room and in the Omaha and Lincoln areas on draft only.

data.name: Chocolate Porter
data.description: "The George Washington"All too often you try a porter and it’s either too sweet or too bitter. Not at SOL!! Our George Washington is lightly hopped to bring out the malty chocolate flavors of the dark grains in this exceptionally smooth dark ale. This beer is an easy drinking version of the Robust Porter style. Enjoy!

breweries.name: Sons of Liberty Aleworks
breweries.description: We are committed to producing excellent quality craft beer as well as providing interesting historical narratives to augment your tasting experience.  We have three screens with a Direct TV sports package for all the games and we are open for Monday night football with great food and $4.00 Imperial pints.

style.name: Robust Porter
style.description: Robust porters are black in color and have a roast malt flavor, often reminiscent of cocoa, but no roast barley flavor. These porters have a sharp bitterness of black malt without a highly burnt/charcoal flavor. Caramel and other malt sweetness should be present and in harmony with other distinguishing porter characters. Robust porters range from medium to full in body and have a malty sweetness. Hop bitterness is medium to high, with hop aroma and flavor ranging from negligible to medium. Diacetyl is acceptable at very low levels. Fruity esters should be evident, balanced with roast malt and hop bitterness.

breweries.name: Lupulin Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Lupulin Brewing is dedicated to making unique beers with attention to quality and flavor.  The company philosophy is one of community involvement, access to the public, and a little splash of idiocracy along the way.  Whether you are a regular or a new comer, we thank you and hope you enjoy our beers.

data.name: Chocolate Porter
data.description:
Rich and decadent. This strong porter is perfect for sipping at the end of the day or to accompany full-flavored foods. The intense, roasty flavor comes from two types of chocolate malt and raw cocoa nibs. Whole vanilla beans introduced post fermentation add complexity and enhance the dessert-like qualities of this full bodied beer.

This beer began life as our Panamanian Porter with the flavors of chocolate, vanilla and banana. A truly unique beer, we felt that all those flavors needed some smoothing out so we changed yeast strains and eliminated the banana flavor (Which came from the yeast strain). The Panamanian Porter did have many fans however, and there may be plans in the future to bring it back for a special occasion. Stay tuned!
data.foodPairings: Big flavors! Barbecue, porterhouse steak, pulled pork all go great. Chocolate desserts or fruit tarts. Aged cheeses like Gouda or Parmesan.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Brown Porter
style.description: Brown porters are mid to dark brown (may have red tint) in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Hangar 24 Craft Brewery
breweries.description: Hangar 24 Craft Brewery began with a true passion for good beer, the absolute love of flying and the pure enjoyment of being around great friends. Founder and Master Brewer Ben Cook and his buddies used to meet at hangar 24 after an afternoon of flying to trade stories, talk aviation, play music and share a few cold ones that Ben just finished brewing at home. These days, the location of where these fine beers are brewed has changed, but the quality time spent enjoying a delicious, handcrafted beer and conversation with friends is the same as ever. Cheers.

data.name: Chocolate Porter
data.description: Dark opaque brown pour with a frothy light tan head, aroma has dark chocolate and hints of roast, taste has big rich dark slightly bitter chocolate, roast malts, creamy mouthfeel.

style.name: Brown Porter
style.description: Brown porters are mid to dark brown (may have red tint) in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Cloudwater Brew Co.
breweries.description:
At the heart of our new venture is a deep love for the changing seasons, each bringing with it an invitation to enjoy the scarcity and abundance our natural environment offers.
We want to showcase the ebb and flow by using seasonal ingredients at their very best, and taking inspiration from the change of lifestyle each season creates.
Along the way there’ll be both old recipes and new experiments, as we use the best of both traditional and cutting edge techniques to create modern seasonal beer.

The UK brewing scene, and the international brewing scene beyond is vibrant and rich.  We're working hard to make the best contribution to modern beer we possibly can.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Baltic-Style Porter
style.description: A true smooth cold-fermented and cold lagered beer, brewed with lager yeast. Black to very deep ruby/garnet in color. Overall, Baltic Porters have a very smooth lagered character with distinctive caramelized sugars, licorice and chocolate-like character of roasted malts and dark sugars. Roasted dark malts should not contribute bitterness, or astringent roast character. A low degree of smokiness from malt may be evident. Debitterized roast malts are best used for this style. Because of its alcoholic strength, aroma may include gentle (low) lager fruitiness (berries, grapes, plums, not banana; ale-like fruitiness from warm temperature fermentation is not appropriate), complex alcohols, cocoa-like, roast malt (and sometimes coffee-like roast barley, yet not bitter). Hop aroma is very low, though a hint of floral or sweet hop aroma can complement aromatics and flavor without dominance. Baltic Porters are not hop bitter dominated and expressed as low to medium-low. Baltic porters range from having medium to full body complemented with a medium-low to medium level of malty sweetness. No butterscotch-like diacetyl or sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should be apparent in aroma or flavor.

breweries.name: Evans Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Evans Brewing Company is a full scale brewing company located in Irvine, California. 

As Orange County’s oldest craft brewery and one of the largest, Evans Brewing Co. brews all of the Bayhawk Ales brands and is in the process of re-branding these beers under the Evans Brewing Company name.
After a 2 year hiatus, the Silver Medal World Beer Cup award winning Evans Lagers will also be making a return to the market. These beers will be brewed at the Irvine brewery by Summer 2015. 

Follow EBC on Instagram @evansbrewingco

data.name: Chocolate Porter
data.description: A traditional English porter brimming with chocolate and roasty flavors.

style.name: Chocolate / Cocoa-Flavored Beer
style.description: Chocolate beers use "dark" chocolate or cocoa in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows chocolate to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. White Chocolate should not be entered into this category. If this beer is a classic style with chocolate or cocoa, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Nexus Brewery
breweries.description:
Nexus Brewery is dedicated on being the Albuquerque brewery that people can count on when it comes to providing amazing tasting beer and excellent food. We love good beer, and that makes our job just that much more fun. We sell delicious New Mexican soul food with a mix of southern comfort food. Come on down to Nexus Brewery and enjoy the beer we brew. We’d love to meet you and pour you a cold one.

You don't just drink a beer; you drink in the experience of life and all that goes with it.

Throw in the best beer in Albuquerque and it's an ExBeerience.

data.name: Chocolate Porter
data.description: We start with a brown porter brewed with dark roasted malts, and add one pound of chocolate per barrel. We then throw in some Madagascar Vanilla beans to accentuate the chocolate flavors, resulting in a decadent porter.

style.name: Brown Porter
style.description: Brown porters are mid to dark brown (may have red tint) in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: River Horse Brewing Company
breweries.description:
You don't have to be in a dead end job to feel like you aren't going anywhere.  That's the way we felt before River Horse.  We were finance geeks living in a world without soul.  Grinding it out everyday for a fee, wearing suits and kissing butt.

Then this brewery chose us...she forced us to ask ourselves, "Is this desk job really how I pictured my life?"  We answered that questions by taking over River Horse in 2007 and have not looked back.  We may not end up as the greatest success story on earth, but at least we had the balls to try.  Sometimes, for better or worse, your dreams get the best of you.

Just remember, it's a big world out there and cubicles don't have doors, so you can walk out anytime.  Come see us when you can.  We are located in Ewing, NJ.  Thanks for supporting the cause.  Hope you enjoy the beer...

style.name: Chocolate / Cocoa-Flavored Beer
style.description: Chocolate beers use "dark" chocolate or cocoa in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows chocolate to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. White Chocolate should not be entered into this category. If this beer is a classic style with chocolate or cocoa, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Trinity Brewhouse
breweries.description:
Always fresh, always crisp.
Crafted with the finest quality hops from around the world, and filtered Scituate Reservoir water from right here in Little Rhody.

The beers, ales, porters and stouts available at the Brewhouse Pub are brewed on premises - ensuring a high quality product that is always satisfying and never flat.

Our Brewmaster takes great pride in providing our customers with the freshest beer in the city.
If we were any fresher...you'd slap us!

Stop by for a pint or two in house - or grab a Growler To Go and enjoy great Trinity Brewhouse Beer at your own leisure.

breweries.name: North Union Brewing Co
breweries.description: Welcome to North Union Brewing Company, founded with the soul aim to produce high quality craft beer for good people to enjoy and savour.

data.name: Chocolate Porter
data.description: Bayhawk's Chocolate Porter is a smooth, full-bodied beer. The roasty, coffee, chocolate flavors are derived from malted grain. It will complement anything from a sweet dessert to a Porterhouse steak. We believe you will not be disappointed...Grab a Bayhawk Chocolate Porter and enjoy life...

breweries.name: Bayhawk Ales
breweries.description: Bayhawk Ales, Orange County's largest microbrewery, began operation in late 1994 with our first beer being poured in February '95. We are a public corporation with over 1000 local and out of state stockholders. Bayhawk specializes in brewing House Beers for many fine restaurants and taverns throughout California, Arizona, Nevada, Oregon, and Washington. We just might be the Greatest Beer You Never Knew You Drank!

data.name: Chocolate Porter
data.description: This specialty batch is a slightly new take on an old recipe. For this robust porter, we added 50 pounds of world-famous Van Otis Chocolate to our kettle to produce a decadent dark ale with a clean, chocolate finish. Black and chocolate malts help marry the base malts to the rich chocolate undertone.

Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Milly's Tavern
breweries.description: Milly's Tavern first opened its doors in January of 2002 at the location of the former Stark Mill Brewery. Milly's opened through the hard work and love of the craft of Master Brewer Peter Telge, a New Hampshire native, who has been brewing his own beers for the better part of 20 years. With the closing of the Stark Mill Brewery and the many changes that have befell the city in the recent years, Peter felt that Manchester, as New Hampshire's Queen City, was sadly falling the way of commercial and contract beers. He, with a dedicated following of fans of his brew, set to work reopening the brewery as "Milly's Tavern," proudly operating as Manchester's only brew pub. We welcome you as our guests to stop by and try a glass of Peter's hard work.

data.name: Chocolate Porter
data.description: A robust English style porter brewed with 20 lbs. of cocoa powder. Dark and creamy with a deep chocolate flavor

breweries.name: Amherst Brewing Company
breweries.description: Amherst Brewing Company is a full-service brewpub located in downtown Amherst, Massachusetts. Our 10-Barrel brewery is visible from the bar and produces some of the finest ales and lagers for serving in our 150-seat restaurant and 100-seat lounge and game room. Brewery tours can be made by appointment. Our giant, brass-top bar seats over 30 people and is fully stocked, including Single Malt Scotches and Small Batch Bourbons. An additional 40 seats are available on our seasonal patio; the best place in town to relax and enjoy an ABC draft or specialty brew while watching passersby. --From Amherst Website

data.name: Chocolate Porter
data.description: This style of beer is classified in the "American Porter" category. The focus is obviously on the very dark roasted malts used in the brewing process to impart a "chocolaty flavor". Our version includes the addition of cocoa powder to intensify the taste of chocolate. This is our Valentine's Special.

Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Horseheads Brewing
breweries.description: Horseheads Brewing broke ground on June 2006 and opened it's doors for business on July 3rd, 2007. The Master Brewer, after "home-brewing" for 8 years, received his education and certificate of concise brewing technology from the Siebel Institute in Chicago.

style.name: Chocolate / Cocoa-Flavored Beer
style.description: Chocolate beers use "dark" chocolate or cocoa in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows chocolate to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. White Chocolate should not be entered into this category. If this beer is a classic style with chocolate or cocoa, the brewer should specify the classic style.

style.name: Brown Porter
style.description: Brown porters are mid to dark brown (may have red tint) in color. No roast barley or strong burnt/black malt character should be perceived. Low to medium malt sweetness, caramel and chocolate is acceptable along with medium hop bitterness. This is a lightto medium-bodied beer. Fruity esters are acceptable. Hop flavor and aroma may vary from being negligible to medium in character.

breweries.name: Rhodell Brewery
breweries.description:
Our bar carries 9 of our hand-crafted beers on draught and also one cask conditioned beer on a traditional British hand pump.

Our Scottish brewer brews over 30 different beer styles throughout the year, ranging from American style Wheat beers to Belgian Dubbels and Tripels and of course Scottish Ales.

Unlike other microbreweries - Our beers do not compromise on flavor!

data.name: Chocolate Pretzel Stout
data.description: Stout brewed with chocolate and pretzels.

style.name: Chocolate / Cocoa-Flavored Beer
style.description: Chocolate beers use "dark" chocolate or cocoa in any of its forms other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character. Under hopping allows chocolate to contribute to the flavor profile while not becoming excessively bitter. White Chocolate should not be entered into this category. If this beer is a classic style with chocolate or cocoa, the brewer should specify the classic style.

breweries.name: Jackalope Brewing Company
breweries.description: Jackalope Brewing Company is owned by Bailey Spaulding and Robyn Virball, two young ingénues with an affection for beer. They met in September 2002 in the tiny Scottish village of St. Andrews, Scotland. Bailey was a Harvard student doing a semester abroad and Robyn was beginning undergrad at St. Andrews. They bonded over being put into the worst dorm for overseas orientation and teaching Danish people how to play beer pong. Though after three months Bailey went back to Cambridge, you can't break the bonds that are made when teaching Europeans drinking games and a true friendship was born. During the next eight years, they both graduated, Bailey went off to Vanderbilt Law School, and Robyn entered the working world, but both thought they were meant for much bigger and more alcoholic things.

data.name: Chocolate Pretzel Sunday Morning Stout
data.description: This barrel aged coffee beast is jacked up on gratuitous amounts of cocoa nibs, cocoa powder, lactose and unrefined sea salt. Lots of roast and dark chocolate play along nicely with bourbon, coffee, and vanilla. The lactose helps balance things out and the sea salt adds a layer of smooth salinity that ties it all up.

style.name: American-Style Imperial Stout
style.description: Black in color, American-style imperial stouts typically have a high alcohol content. Generally characterized as very robust. The extremely rich malty flavor and aroma are balanced with assertive hopping and fruity-ester characteristics. Bitterness should be moderately high to very high and balanced with full sweet malt character. Roasted malt astringency and bitterness can be moderately perceived but should not overwhelm the overall character. Hop aroma is usually moderately-high to overwhelmingly hop-floral, -citrus or -herbal. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: Weyerbacher Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Established in 1995, Weyerbacher Brewing Company, Inc. was founded in the historic city of Easton, Pennsylvania. We bring artistry, mischief and adventure to the world of brewing so every Weyerbacher beer is an incredible experience.

We, the brewers of Weyerbacher, are continually pushing the envelope of taste experiences, obliterating style guidelines and having a blast while we're at it! Cheers!

style.name: Herb and Spice Beer
style.description: Herb beers use herbs or spices (derived from roots, seeds, fruits, vegetable, flowers, etc.) other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character, though individual characters of herbs and/or spices used may not always be identifiable. Under hopping often, but not always, allows the spice or herb to contribute to the flavor profile. Positive evaluations are significantly based on perceived balance of flavors. Note: Chili-flavored beers that emphasize heat rather than chili flavor should be entered as a "spiced" beer.  A statement by the brewer explaining what herbs or spices are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. Specifying a style upon which the beer is based may help evaluation. If this beer is a classic style with an herb or spice, the brewer should specify the classic style. If no Chocolate or Coffee category exists in a competition, then chocolate and coffee beers should be entered in this category.

breweries.name: Loe's Brewing Company
breweries.description: Loe's Brewing Company  is a small craft brewery located in Hickory North Carolina. We specialize in handcrafted artisanal lagers and ales. We are one of the smallest breweries in North Carolina and also one of the smallest in the country. We have a 1.5 bbl brewhouse , 1 and 3 bbl fermentation tanks. Being so small we can afford to take more time and effort into our beers. We utilize many ingredients from all over the world, selecting only the finest grains, cultured yeast, fresh whole hops, and  our mountain water that is perfect for producing the best beers possible.  Another advantage of being small is that we can produce a wide variety of styles so our selection will always be changing. We will produce beers that fit the season and year round classics. Loe's Brewing takes pride in producing the finest handcrafted beers, and we are sure that once you try our beer you will agree that bigger is not always better , and will notice the difference that craft beer has to offer.  Cheers- The Loe's Brewing Team

locations.name: Hickory
locations.hoursOfOperation: Our taproom hours will be Fri, Sat, Sun  2pm -10pm.  Longer hours available on request.
locations.hoursOfOperationNotes: Our taproom hours will be Fri, Sat, Sun  2pm -10pm.  Longer hours available on request.

style.name: Braggot
style.description: A harmonious blend of mead and beer, with the distinctive characteristics of both. A wide range of results are possible, depending on the base style of beer, variety of honey and overall sweetness and strength. Beer flavors tend to somewhat mask typical honey flavors found in other meads.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: Herb and Spice Beer
style.description: Herb beers use herbs or spices (derived from roots, seeds, fruits, vegetable, flowers, etc.) other than or in addition to hops to create a distinct (ranging from subtle to intense) character, though individual characters of herbs and/or spices used may not always be identifiable. Under hopping often, but not always, allows the spice or herb to contribute to the flavor profile. Positive evaluations are significantly based on perceived balance of flavors. Note: Chili-flavored beers that emphasize heat rather than chili flavor should be entered as a "spiced" beer.  A statement by the brewer explaining what herbs or spices are used is essential in order for fair assessment in competitions. Specifying a style upon which the beer is based may help evaluation. If this beer is a classic style with an herb or spice, the brewer should specify the classic style. If no Chocolate or Coffee category exists in a competition, then chocolate and coffee beers should be entered in this category.

breweries.name: Ass Clown Brewing Company
breweries.description: We are imaginative brewers specializing in small batches, Making handcrafted an understatement. Our ales lack filtration and utilize low carbonation to maximize flavor.

data.name: Chocolate Rain
data.description: Imperial Stout Aged in Bourbon Barrels with Cocoa Nibs and Vanilla Beans

style.name: American-Style Imperial Stout
style.description: Black in color, American-style imperial stouts typically have a high alcohol content. Generally characterized as very robust. The extremely rich malty flavor and aroma are balanced with assertive hopping and fruity-ester characteristics. Bitterness should be moderately high to very high and balanced with full sweet malt character. Roasted malt astringency and bitterness can be moderately perceived but should not overwhelm the overall character. Hop aroma is usually moderately-high to overwhelmingly hop-floral, -citrus or -herbal. Diacetyl (butterscotch) levels should be absent.

breweries.name: The Bruery
breweries.description:
A boutique craft brewery located in Orange County, California specializing in experimental and barrel aged beer. Our name is a fusion of 'brewery' with our family name, Rue.

Our calling is to create beers with character and depth using the simplest and purest of means. We do not filter or pasteurize our beers. Most of our bottled beers gain carbonation through bottle conditioning, allowing carbonation to naturally occur through a secondary bottle fermentation. We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and we will proudly state what we put in our beers.
